>>128103391 >>128103537 >>128103646 >>128104098 >>128104302 >>128104446 >>128105312 >>128106568
File: 134756-8051808-gohan02.jpg (46 KB, 510x404)
46 KB JPG
yeah, Gohan should have been the path to a bigger DB universe, not Goku, i.e. an expansion into a sci fi story (which seemed to be where things were going and then for some reason we went right back to magic and fantasy in the Buu saga)
what we got was an expansion of the afterlife in the DB universe because our central character was Goku, and Goku dies (a lot, for a hero)

what we should have gotten was Gohan, being the friendly and inquisitive genius that he is, going out and continuing relations with the people of namek and eventually other worlds as a sort of new paragon (taking over after Goku)
it's really tragic that in the canon Goku takes Uub to be his apprentice and not his own goddamn son, because Gohan was already being set up as the most powerful character, and he needed the extra edge of his intelligence to take it that next step further than Goku
having Gohan start a sort antithesis to Frieza's empire as a galactic police force would have been waaaaaaay more interesting than the shitty goodbye ending we got (and now... DB super?.... fuck this shit is terrible)
we could instead, RIGHT NOW, be watching Gohan and the Z Force fighting galactic level threats and using what his dad taught him (and/or piccolo) to pass on his knowledge and lead the galaxy to.... more.... awesomeness? yeah.
>>

Anonymous
07/15/15(Wed)03:40:32 No.128107314
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)19:40:32 No.128107314 ▶
>>128107488
>>128105862
>Can someone explain the origin of gohanfags for me?

There's Gohan fans (ie; the people who like Gohan for Gohan, which includes his own personal goal of being a scholar and raising a family after a less than stable childhood. These people understand that Gohan, as a character, always loved and respected his father for being a kind person who protected the weak, to the point he idolizes him and Piccolo, growing up and wants to be a 'heroic' like them, which, in turn is where The Great Saiyaman persona comes from).

And then there's 'Gohanfags' (ie; the fuckers with serious father issues, which they shamelessly project onto Goku's and Gohan's relationship, while constantly bitching about how either of Gohan's parents ruined him, by forcing him to study, whereas, in their headcanon, Gohan is really this unchained badass fighting God that Toriyama abandoned in favor of Goku. These are the people that still perpetuate that retarded "Piccolo is Gohan's real father!" meme and legit believe that Gohan is secretly filled with angst and disdain for his father. In this thread, you'll likely see the latter of these two facets of Gohan's 'fans', especially if there's a hefty amount of bitching about Goku stealing Gohan's spotlight and how Akira Toriyama was forced, by his mean ol' editors, to ditch Gohan, despite Toriyama flat out stating the opposite). Very rarely you'll find reasonable Gohanfags, because they're blinded by nostalgia/their headcanon to be reasoned with.
>>

>I don't understand why Vegeta is popular.

Edgelords and women. That's the entirety of Vegeta's fanbase, post Namek. From the Saiyan arc through Namek, Vegeta was a good character, in that he was as ruthless as he was cunning.

Once he gets back to Earth, the character goes full retarded with "Muh Pride" faggotry. Anyone who watched watches the series, prior to Z would find his character a piss-poor retread of Tenshinhan and Piccolo Jr., only without the aspect where he puts his bullshit aside in lieu of a bigger problem, like those characters did.

However 'DBZ kids' that saw the DBZ before Dragon Ball, love Veggie to pieces, especially girls, because he's a hardass shitter that's easy the self-insert to, especially since he's main rival is a guy who's too forgiving for his own good. Edgelords and girls love those kind of characters.

Anonymous
07/15/15(Wed)00:33:52 No.128101169
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)16:33:52 No.128101169 ▶
>>128101354 >>128101365
>>128100562
People in different areas of Japan say different words at the end of their sentences as part of a regional accent. Like how Canadians stereotypically say "eh?" all the time. Oda takes opposite sentence endings from different areas of the country, combines them, and makes interesting fake accents.

Dasuyan is a combination of Osaka's "-desu", which you use when stating something factually, and Kansai's "-yan", which you use when asking a question.

Neptune's Jamon, Jora's Zamasu, and Bastille's Dara are like this too.
>>
Anonymous
07/15/15(Wed)00:34:50 No.128101203
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)16:34:50 No.128101203 ▶

>>128103161 >>128103246 >>128103267 >>128103295 >>128103306 >>128103342 >>128103540 >>128105160 >>128105225
At Kyros' house in the flowerfield
Sabo tells Robin to not wake up Luffy, he just came to see him one last time before leaving
CP0 is returning to the island to capture Sabo and other revolutionaries.
In a day or two Dressrosa will be packed with people. He advises the Strawhats to leave as early as possible.
Zoro and Franky comments they had no idea Luffy had another brother besides Ace.
Sabo explains he was supposed to be dead all these years, and tells his story.

After the trio became brothers and that fateful day where he met Dragon and later gunned down by the Celestial dragon, as he sank in the sea Dragon came and rescued him before he sank.
When he regained consciousness, Sabo had no memory of who he was, or even his own name.
The revolutionary points out his belongings have the name Sabo, but he cannot recall.
Dragon says he's certain the child is a Goa nobility and another revolutionary offers to find his parents and return him to them, but Sabo yells in rejection.
He'd rather be taken away from here.

Sabo explains to Zoro that while he didn't have any memory, he felt strong desire to not return to his parents.
He explains it was Ace who brought his memory back... at the worst timing.

back to flashback

Revolutionaries were reading the news about Whitebeard, and how he and Fire Fist Ace died.
Upon hearing that name and seeing Ace's image, memory floods Sabo's head.
As he hears details of Ace's death and regains memory of their time together, tears flood Sabo's eyes.
Ace... is my brother!

Anonymous
07/15/15(Wed)01:30:03 No.128103323
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)17:30:03 No.128103323 ▶
Sabo screams and passes out.
He sleeps for three days before regaining consciousness, and sees worried Hack and crying Koala.
Koala tearfully asks Sabo if he's going to quit the revolutionary now that his memory is regained.
Sabo puts her worries to rest telling her he has no intention of leaving them, and that he needs to speak with Dragon.

2 years later...
Sabo tells his comrades to let the entire revolutionary army know, he's going after a devil fruit.

Sabo's reunion with Luffy. The silent conversation we didn't hear is now revealed.
It's me, Luffy! Sabo greets his brother. Luffy doesn't recognize him and tells him whoever you are if you're after the Mera Mera fruit you're an opponent! And my name is Lucy, don't call me Luffy!

But Sabo replies, a disguise can't hide my brother from me.
Luffy replies brother? Only person who can call me brother is Ace who died, and.... Luffy realizes at this point.
Tears swell in his eyes as Luffy realizes it's Sabo. At first he refuses to believe him, but upon mentioning stealing Dadan's sake, Luffy hugs him in tears.
Luffy's screams are illegible as he can't even talk straight. Sabo thanks Luffy for staying alive.
Luffy cries he allowed Ace to die in front of his eyes, but Sabo tells him he's glad he didn't lose TWO brothers that day in his absence.
If I lost you, I would have been all alone. Thank you for surviving, Luffy.
He asks Luffy if he can have the Mera Mera fruit, and Luffy nods in tears in agreement.

flashback ends

Sabo gets ready to leave, and shows the straw hat crew Luffy's Vivre card he made.
He tears off a piece for himself, and gives the rest to Zoro.
He tells them Luffy may cause a lot of trouble, but please take care of him.
Robin waves farewell with a smile, while Franky tearfully tells him to leave him up to them.
Zoro laughs, says you sound just like Ace.

Sabo calls Hack, and tells him he's on his way.
Hack tries to ask him about how Luffy is doing, but Sabo cuts off the phone early again.
Apparently this is his quirky habit, as Hack yells and swings a punch

Sabo rides a pack of crows as he heads back to his men.
He asks the leading crow if they're ready to sail, and the crow answers "anytime".
Well then, let's hurry!

End of chapter, no chapter next issue.

>Haute couture (/ˌoʊt kuːˈtjʊər/; French pronunciation: [ot kuˈtyʁ]; French for "high sewing" or "high dressmaking" or "high fashion") refers to the creation of exclusive custom-fitted clothing. Haute couture is fashion that is constructed by hand from start to finish, made from high quality, expensive, often unusual fabric and sewn with extreme attention to detail and finished by the most experienced and capable sewers, often using time-consuming, hand-executed techniques
>>

07/14/15(Tue)17:23:33 No.128083828
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)09:23:33 No.128083828 ▶
>>128083089
Huh, I played a game called Bloody Knuckles at school, but it was different to this. You'd have to flick a coin from one side of the table to the other in 3 attempts or less so it was dangling over the edge. Then, you'd flick the coin up and if you caught it while it was in midair you'd get to shoot the coin into the other player's knuckles.

I had absolutely no skill but I played loads of times and never lost a game because I never quit, even if there was blood everywhere cause I was a fucking idiot when I was at school
>>
Anonymous
07/14/15(Tue)17:23:35 No.128083831
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)09:23:35 No.128083831 ▶
>>128084030
>>128083089
>>128082781
The version we played was where you had three quarters, you would line them up in a triangle pattern and you had to shoot the closest one to you between the other two without knocking it off the table or hitting the other two, and the end goal was to get it into a "net" on the other side created by your opponent's index and pinky fingers. If you scored, you got to do >>128082973 to your opponent. Fucking shit hurt like a bitch too.
>>

I'm still trying to figure out the exact rules for this.

You can only move the ruler buy pushing/hitting down on the side of the ruler, or by pushing/hitting the bottom of the ruler. You can only push/hit the sides if you are fully off the table.

When they say "3 hits to escape", do you just do all 3 right away or do you still take turns?

Also it seems the turn order is just whatever they feel like.
>Nattsun hit Renge as an example, then said "you can go first"
>Hotarun pinned Renge
>Renge used the Waterfall Climb freeing herself but not hitting anyone
>Koma said "I'm next" and hit Renge partially off the edge
>Renge used the Swallow Reversal to pin Koma
>Koma broke free offscreen, probably hitting no one, but definitely not Nattsun considering the distance
>Nattsun flies over Koma with her modified ruler
(Koma tells Hotarun to go next)

>>128094496
File: 1431039486212.jpg (1.17 MB, 1708x1432)
1.17 MB JPG
>>128092388
There's a new character introduced in volume 8 and it also shows a little bit of what happened in New York from 3 years ago, and in volume 7 it brings up the fact that Leo's eyes start to steam/burn when he over-uses them although that's not super important so much as it probably looks confusing if you don't know about it. You won't miss anything really big, but bits and pieces of the world get filled out gradually, like showing you KK's family or Chain's werewolf gang. It's probably fine as long as you go back and read it later though. Volume 10 is probably the most important for having the biggest character-focused arc and filling in some of the details about the god eyes.
>>

07/15/15(Wed)00:09:33 No.128100156
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)16:09:33 No.128100156 ▶
>>128100743
File: the hell is this manslut (...).png (34 KB, 321x189)
34 KB PNG
>>128099157
>Seriously, I don't remember ever hearing most of disc 2 in the show

Then you should pay attention more. These were memorable enough that I can tell you where nearly all of them came from without even putting the episodes on to check.

1．Catch Me If You Can
Episode 2, when Chain is following the blood fuse.

2．A Way Out
Unused, but there might have been an instrumental version played at some point; I seem to remember it during a battle scene.

3．World Goes Round
Episode 3, hospital scene near the end.

4．On My Own
Unforgettable.

5．In The City
Episode 6, very beginning.

6．The Land of Nod
Unused.

7．Dust
Episode 4, after the battle with the Blood Breeds.

8．Just A Game
Don't remember, but it's definitely been used.

9．BCCGS
Used all over the place, I think the first time is during the Libra member introductions during the episode 2 pre-credits.

10．It's Magic
Episode 5, in the scenes with White.

11．At The Gates
Episode 3 at the Don's place, and episode 4 when Abrams is talking about Blood Breeds.

12．Epi femen dife a
Episode 8. Master's battle music.

13．Epigraph
Unused. Sounds like the kind of thing we can expect to hear in episode 12, though.

14．World Goes Round(Reprise)
This has been used before, I just can't remember where.

15．White Gloves
Shows up in a lot of scenes with the twins. Vocal version was definitely used in episode 11 and possibly other places.

16．Hello,world! !(TV size version)
OP
>>

Anonymous
07/15/15(Wed)03:43:49 No.128107408
Anonymous 07/15/15(Wed)19:43:49 No.128107408▶
File: 1398406985015.png (481 KB, 800x600)
481 KB PNG
I'd like to share my experienced with kanji. 9 months ago, in October 2014, I finished Core2k and started up a new deck, which I planned to only add words with kanji I didn't know to. The first word I added was 堂々 because I didn't know the kanji 堂. Now, 9 months later, I see *so few* new kanji that I am ended the plan and now adding pretty much any word that I struggled with reading. For instance I know the kanji in 昆虫 but I failed to sight-read it. So yeah. In my experiences, it took 15~ months before I didn't see any new kanji. In this time I read 5 VNs and a couple of manga series, which his not a lot, but I imagine anyone else with a job would also find themselves reading lethargically. Well that's all folks.

P.S. I recently saw 蟷螂の斧 which had 3 new kanji in a single phrase, however I opted not to learn it because the effort expenditure vs reward was far too low. There are exceptions like this everywhere.
>>
